Usually the best way to reduce it is getting sound dampening sheets installed in the doors first and see if that helps
If that doesn't  can do floor and pillars
They help a lot with road noise and vibrations
Other than that  can consider quieter tires too
The weight doesn't increase by too much with the dampening sheets
Minor difference like carrying one full carton in the boot usually

How do you properly assess a car with 6 previous owners
Or do you err on the side of caution and not buy it?
Of course Mr Anwo  we are all friends here!
RX8 is a ticking time bomb  dont bother
u will go through more apex seals than tyres
If it is an older enthusiast car  many owners hold for short periods of time before selling as they don't lose much/make a profit
But for cars like this  keep aside 7 to 10k min. for wear and tear and repairs
As they are prone to higher wear and tear like Mr Xun suggested

If it is a regular commuter car that has gone through a lot of owners  don't bother unless you can get a PPI and see that it is good  and use the 6 owners as a bargaining chip. If cannot do inspection  walk away as the chances of it having a shady past and poor maintenance are higher

If you are asking this question when purchasing a car. it is better to buy new or with Sgcarmart warranty.Since buying 2nd car there is always a risk of lemon  just how much time effort and money you are willing to fix
thats why there are still "moneypit" cars around ğŸ˜
learn more now so when bull market returns  can dump stuff and buy car
